comments:
Eclipse 3.0M6
CDT Build 2.0.0.0031
Sun JDK 1.4.2_02

Test case:
1. Create a managed make C++ exec project, call it MgdCpp (for example).
2. Add a file, call it main.cpp (for example).
3. Add a main() routine to main.cpp.
4. Build MgdCpp.
5. From the C/C++ Projects window, rename the project to Yay_NPE (for example).

The following exception is generated and dumped to the .log file:


!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.core 4 4 Feb 09, 2004 13:46:52.93
!MESSAGE Background Indexer Crash Recovery
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.managedbuilder.internal.core.ManagedBuildInfo.getIncludePaths(ManagedBuildInfo.java:362)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.SourceIndexer.indexFile(SourceIndexer.java:82)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AbstractIndexer.index(AbstractIndexer.java:353)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.impl.Index.add(Index.java:110)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddCompilationUnitToIndex.indexDocument(AddCompilationUnitToIndex.java:29)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.indexing.AddFileToIndex.execute(AddFileToIndex.java:39)
	at
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.run(JobManager.java:384)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Cc: to Bogdan FYI

Reassign to Sean.

Additional note: 

This exception seems to be generated with every subsequent project-related save.
 The only way to stop CDT from generating the exception is to restart Eclipse.

This problem is related to the same error that causes 44159; the managed build 
manager does not listen for project events so the information in the build 
model is out of date after a rename. The indexer asks for includes paths and 
the build model honks on a null pointer.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 44159 ***
